title: Appalled
body: Returned a doctor call yesterday 22.3.2021 at 16.51 hrs . The receptionist that answered was so rude and abrupt . I have been with this surgery for many many yrs and have never encountered such a rude receptionist. Never even bothered to say good bye , just hung up on me . Who ever this was really needs to change her job as customer relations in this profession is vital . Extremely angry patient that was treated disrespectfully by your receptionist.

title: Not Fit for Purpose
body: It's ironic that in order to leave a review it is compulsory to state when you visited the surgery - how does one do that that, I wonder? My mother spend two hours trying to get through to the surgery yesterday to chase up her second Covid injection as her three months since the first one ends on 19 April and she has heard nothing. When she finally got through she was told that appointments are not being made for that far in advance (just over a week - really?!) and was told by the receptionist that she would have to wait for her text and then, as she does not have a smart phone she would have to phone back to make her appointment. So another two hours on hold awaits her, assuming she can actually get through at all - when she booked her first injection, she sat in a telephone queue for an hour, selected the option on the automated system 'to book a Covid injection' at which point it just told her that 'this service is not currently available' and cut her off. She tried this four times on different days and at different times of the day. I have no idea when this service 'is currently available'. She then she got wise and selected the option to speak to a receptionist and then waited another hour to do so - a handy tip for anybody else trying to book their jab. Still, her telephone provider will be very happy, as it's earning well out of this. It's simply not acceptable to blame this lack of service on Covid. I have friends  of the same age who are lucky enough to be registered at a practice in Rainham, and not only are they able to get through to make an appointment of a GP consultation when they need to, the GP has also called them unbidden to check in on them. Needless to say, they have had both of their jabs. Patients registered at The Thorndike Centre can only dream of this kind of service, but it is obviously achievable by other busy practices affected by Covid.

title: Above & Beyond
body: I visited Dermatology early today without an appointment and in a state of panic after undergoing a procedure yesterday. I was experiencing much more pain than I had previously and was very concerned. The nurse I saw was very professional and reassuring, explaining the reasons for the increased pain, then checking and re-dressing my wound. All this before she had officially started work! You are a credit to the department and a true nursing professional. Thank you.

title: Very rude and unprofessional staff
body:
After 50+ attempts to get through to the surgery and being on the phone for an hour, my query wasn't dealt with, when asked the name of the person I was speaking with, they simply hanged up!!
Appalling service!!!

title: Helpful Staff
body: I am so pleased that I have moved to your surgery as the service has been so good.  I had a phone call with a GP today who was very helpful.

title: Great
body:
Very friendly, efficient, and safety concious
The staff at reception made you feel at ease.
the nursing staff where caring and understanding

title: Very kind thoughtful practice
body:
Quick service when needed on the occasions I have had to make appointments thankfully not too often. 
I do try not to be calling for the slightest thing .

title: Great practice
body: I attended at A and E on the 7th April presenting with facial droop. Suspecting that I may have had a mini stroke. The tests were done and more tests the following day were done. I had cause to attend again on the 9th April fearing another Mini Stroke. I was dealt with swiftly upon my arrival in the department and with compassion. Thankfully it wasn’t another episode but Thankyou for all that you do, Greatly appreciated.

title: Nobody Answers the Phone
body:
I have been with Farfield all my life (42 years). Over the past couples of years or so, it has gone down hill and since Covid happened, it has become even worse.
In Nov 2020 I tried phoning the surgery as I was running low on my medication. I phoned over 3 days. On the third day I called 60 times, leaving it ringing for up to 10 minutes every time. Eventually someone did pick up the phone. A few times over the 3 days, I was actually cut off in the middle of trying to get through.
In November 2020, I also requested access to my Medical Records. The letter finally arrived in March 2021. However, on receiving my request, I also received someone else's as well! I went down to the surgery to show ID 10th March and as of now (9th April), I still don't have access to my records. I have tried phoning the surgery to 'chase up' my Medical Records request, again letting it ring and ring for up to 10 minutes every time, no one answers.
Also, why are there always so many cars in the car park when there's hardly anyone in the surgery?

author: cricketcb38
title: Waiting for Covid vaccination
body:
After patiently waiting for a response to several emails regarding other practices in the area. I got absolutely no response to my questions. Other practitioners in the area are now vaccinating the age groups of forty? No response or reply as when or when the fifties groping would start?  
I actually have had to book my vaccination via nhs websites in different parts of the area.

title: So helpful
body: From booking telephone appointment to seeing the doctor when I was anxious was so good, had a referral within 24 hours best surgery!!

title: vaccination
body: my husband and I attended Whitely House for our Coronavirus vaccines and were very pleased with the treatment we received. We do not normally attend the clinic, unfortunately but none the less the treatment we received was excellent.

title: Thank you is not enough
body:
Been with practice since it opened.
Excellent doctors and staff.
Last physical appointment concern about earache and swollen glands. Ultrasound organised and cancer discovered within a week. Cancer treatment finished November 27th. Doctors kept in touch via mobile to see how I was coping. Reception staff always obliging throughout. Pharmacy staff always helpful with all medications needed with very fast supply. Nothing was too much trouble with questions answered plus advice given. On going after effects explained with reassurances that all will get better in time, hence thank you is not enough for Budbrooke Medical Centre and of course all the wonderful people working for the NHS.

title: Amazing practice
body: Had vaccination today very well organised and amazing staff keeping people safe and reassuring them if worried 10+ stars!

title: Unable to get through on the telephone
body: i have recently been given medication following a telephone conversation with a doctor who seemed to think I had missed a previous call. The information i was given, and in the manner it was given, was both unsettling and alarming, with little or no real explanation for the findings of tests. The medication needs to be closely monitored through regular blood tests and the dosage needs to be carefully regulated. the medication sat at the local pharmacy for several days uncollected as no one from either the reception or medical staff let me know it was there. Whilst i understand that there are lots of current health problems in the community a few common courtesies do not go amiss. i have phoned the surgery over 80 times and cannot get through and was told that calling in person was not allowed. Frustrated is the least I would say here.

title: Practice Review
body: I am Happy to be a patient with this practice ,I find all staff to be helpful and efficient and Doctors to be friendly and caring of your health matters

title: Bad Customer Service
body: I registered with the practice last week as i moved to the area. I understand at the time i got told it takes 2 weeks to be registered which was fine at the time. I am 12 weeks pregnant and i got a call from my midwife saying i have a urine infection and need antibiotics. I told her i have just registered and have been told it will take 2 weeks. she told me to contact the practice and explain the situation and just get an email from them so she can send the information so that i can get my prescription to which i did. my midwife then contacted me this morning to say she had a reply back from the practice to say im not registered patient at the practice. I then had to call the practice again explain the whole situation to then be told they will register me over the phone. Once they did that i then got told the doctor will call me on monday between 9am and 11am at this point i was getting annoyed and responded by saying i am pregnant i have an infection i need antibiotics you have the email from my midwife can a doctor just action it to which i got told they dont have the email as i wasn't registered. i responded by saying i am registered now over the phone so what if i get my midwife to resend the email to which they still said no and said we dont have any appointments today so it will have to be on monday. I then hung up the phone and called my midwife who was apalled by what i was told and said the fact the practice was saying they didnt have the email was untrue as she got a reply from them to say i wasnt registered. I then left it to my midwife to contact the practice. Once she had she called me back and she was annoyed she said she had an arguement with whoever she spoke to at the practice and instead she had contacted the hospital registrar and got the prescription done for me but i would have to pick it up from the hospital pharmacy. I understand they couldnt do anything by me speaking to them but this was another healthcare professional contacting them which is absolutely appalling and unproffessional. This also  meant that i had to take time off work finish work early to then go from ilford to leytonstone by tube and bus as i dont drive to go to the hospital and pick up my antibiotics. I am very upset and annoyed and lets say i will be looking to register elsewhere because if i was treated like this over the phone whats it going to be like when im registered and need appointments. I would not reccomend this practice to anybody!

title: Efficient
body: Went for my second AZ vaccine and was very impressed with the efficiecy and displine and way everything was organised.

title: Answer the phone!
body: While I understand that the NHS is extremely stretched, I’m still disgusted by the lack of empathy and communication I’ve received. The phones are rarely answered, if they are then you met with patronising staff and few available appointments. They mainly suggest using the e-consult service, which isn’t an option most of the time due to sever or account errors. Meaning people are going without important medication and medical advice, which then results in more issues for the already stretched university and NHS.

title: Absolutely Unprofessional & rude.
body: The receptionist is absolutely Unprofessional, rude and lack of respect towards the patient. She did not bother to listen my concern at all. Simply advised me to go to the A&E without even knowing whether it was suitable for A&E or not. This attitude puts pressure on the A&E which is not right to the others who actually need the A&E. A disgrace and a complete waste of taxpayers money on a very poor practice.

title: E consult service shockingly bad
body:
Tried to contact GP through e consult. Filled form in on 31/03/21 and was told I would be contacted via phone or email before 02/04/21 by 18:30. I was not contacted so nudged the surgery via the original e mail that I hadn’t heard anything. I got an email saying I would be contacted on 07/04/21 and that I have to make myself available all day!!!!!
I work clinically at the hospital and have no phone reception so would like to think if I do not answer the phone I will get an email for contact. No, I get another no reply, computer generated email to say I was called twice and didn’t answer. No I didn’t answer because I was looking after MY patients. I try to call the surgery and there is a queue of >15 people. I only have a mobile and are they going to pay my bill! 
I have not been contacted since so assume my needs are not important. I understand things are hard at the moment but really this is unacceptable and I worry that elderly or vulnerable patients are being neglected. Please do something to contact patients if they are working and cannot answer the phone. I cannot take a day off in the hope you will call. There is no reason you cannot send an email that I can reply to!

title: Can be very intimidating
body: I’ve been a member of this practice for my entire life and so haven’t had any other experience with any other practices. The doctors I see are generally very nice and helpful. Never had any real issues. However, the receptionists can be very rude. I’m on medication for depression and anxiety and have to ring up every month for repeat prescriptions. I find it hard to ring up due to anxiety and sometimes it takes me around a week to pluck up the courage to ring. It makes mefeel like I’m being a nuisance to them and wasting their time. This has resulted in me occasionally missing days of medication and having difficult, painful and frightening experiences. I think I’m going to look at changing practice.

title: Wonderful Care!
body: I just wanted to say a huge thank you to the wonderful nurses in the EPU. They are truly outstanding! I've had to go to the unit every few days for the last 7 weeks and the team have been incredible - so caring, compassionate and professional. I'm actually going to miss seeing them! Thank you Frimley

title: phone appointment protocol
body: There is little point in asking us when we last visited the GP, is there? We cannot visit! Instead, we get offered a phone appointment. The Receptionist gives you a day but is unable to give you an approximate time. You wait all day and all evening. Not a bleep. When you enquire, Reception claims the GP tried to phone but got no connection. OK, so there might have been no signal. Some practices try 3 times to get through. What, I would like to know, is Silsden and Steeton's protocol when you don't get an answer first time?

title: Excellent care
body:
The care I received at Nuffield Leeds was excellent. From the pre-operation assessment, through my surgery and recovery all staff I had contact with were friendly, professional and caring. They provided my with reassurance at every point I required it and answered all of the questions I had. Following surgery staff quickly attended my room when I pressed the buzzer for support.  
The hospital is very clean and I felt very safe there. At no point did I feel I was at an increased risk of Covid and was as relaxed as I could be before and after surgery without the additional concerns of becoming unwell with Covid. Would highly recommend the hospital.

title: Bad experience with reception
body: I normally have nothing but good things to say about bitterne surgery but this time the receptionist was very rude to me  and mum-shamed me for calling to get some advice from a doctor regarding my son's health, she tried to make me feel like I was a bad mum, I didn't argue as I was scared she wouldn't book my baby in. I spoke to the doctor about my son and he said that all what I was doing was correct and that it's always good to get doctor's opinion. Is not fair nor correct that the receptionist judge and try to make people feel bad for trying to get medical support.

title: Worryingly slow
body: I had an echocardiogram over 4 weeks ago which was reported it was abnormal by the radiologist. I called to find out when my consultant was going to see me and they told me the report of the echocardiogram would not be ready at least until end of April due to lack of staff typing reports. I had emergency surgery few months ago and living for weeks knowing that something is not right is affecting my mental health badly. I am very concerned about my future care.

title: Terrible booking system
body: Impossible to get a doctors appointment - if you are not able to telephone at the exact time that appointments are released there are none available. Booking system needs to be changed. Need to improve doctor to patient ratio.

title: Rude Receptionists
body: I have been with this surgery for over 2 years now. Receptionists are so rude and extremely unhelpful. Infact one of them in the morning shifts think of herself a doctor.

title: Awful
body: Never have any appointments and the most unhelpful reception staff rude and arrogant and don’t actually want to help!ring back at 8am and 2mins past 8am there’s no appointments! And no one picks up the phones for atleast 25mins if you ring any other time

title: A nonsense service, not fit for purpose
body:
A nonsense service at the expense of patient care; all a cost cutting exercise pretending to be more efficient than direct referrals to hospital - I blame a lack of leadership and governance and the absence of quality control. I must wait 8 weeks for MRI, in agony, have osteoporosis, but told all clinicians are doing covid vaccinations, so I can't have the initial conversation with a clinician to establish the appropriate next steps. Logged a complaint, told 30 days before aknowledged, asked twice for a manager call back, not heard from anyone - utter non professionalism and a pretend service trying to save money at patients expense.
Patients need clarity of the process, reassurance they will be seen in a timely way, meaningful communication and direction; otherwise mistrust occurs and a desperate feeling of exclusion from healthcare services.

title: Great practice
body: Extremely efficient service On time ,in and out within 10 min. Signage very clear directions to vaccination perfect. Attentive and polite staff. Decided to walk to Health Centre as thought car parking would be a problem However plenty parking bays were available. Easy access to Well Pharmacy on site making for all round excellent experience

title: Good organisation
body:
Both my 1st & 2nd vaccination have been administered with excellent skill. The staff & volunteers made me & everyone feel special, there kindness was very much appreciated I’m sure.
I just wish most doctors receptionist treated patients with such respect & not like often the case is, I feel the person I talk to requiring help is not accommodating at all.

title: Angels on Earth
body:
Fantastic, incredible, wonderful, caring , compassionate people.

Who else could do this job ???

Everybody within the NHS especially the at Leeds General Infirmary, Neurosurgery, intensive care and high dependency unit you have my eternal gratitude....you deserve so much more xxx

I am now and forward in your debt, I can't imagine how I'm ever going to repay you for the care you have give my wife.

You truly are,

ANGELS on EARTH

title: Impossible to get appointment, even emergency…
body: Been suffering with vertigo and tried to get an advice from surgery (asked either for nurse or gp) was told that nurse was busy doing vaccinations that day so will not be able to call back and for GPs I was suppose to call at 8.30. Been advised to speak to 111. Followed the advise from gp surgery called 111 and due to severe symptoms was referred back to GP and was advised that they will be aware and HAVE  to see me (not just a phone call!) within next 6 hours. Called back to surgery to make an appointment (as advised by 111 service) only to be told that no one is available. After further 15 minutes of arguing with receptions been told that she finally will pass a note to GP, but cannot guarantee that they will call back (not a face to face appointment as been advised by 111 service!) as they are very busy! Absolutely ludicrous!

title: Very unhelpful reception staff
body: I  am deaf and when I need to make appointments via phone, I ask Brunswick Centre reception to make an appointment for me which they are loathed to do. They first off say sorry we dont do that. Then because I request politely that it needs to be done they resentfully keep emailing me nonsense I mean about 10 emails with wrong information  and entirely irrelevant to what I have requested. They give the impression of being willfully obstructive rather than just make an an appointment. Which would have taken them less time and effort. The reception staff do not seem to know what they are doing. I would be surprised if they were actually qualified to work as a receptionist in any job let alone  Drs Office where people may need a little more help because of suffering poor health.

title: Brilliant Surgery
body:
Went for my second Covid jab. Was seen very quickly. Had my injection didn't feel a thing. Lovely friendly nurse. In and out in no time. A great experience.
All the staff there very friendly and polite.

title: CoviD19 Vaccination
body:
Well organised and efficient.
Small queue with correct distancing, face coverings and handwash facilities.
Minimal waiting. Very positive experience.

title: Great practice
body: Went for our 2nd COVID jab had notifications for mine but not the wife’s phone reception who were very helpful to get both done at the same time she received hers in no time at all. On to the day of our jabs the efficiency of every one involved was first class from parking the car through to our jabs to leaving everybody was helpful and friendly and jovial thank you all

title: Caring and professional
body:
I broke my wrist and needed to have surgery for this. After A&E (which was also a great experience under the circumstances) I was referred to the trauma team and had my operation as soon as they were able to schedule me in. Throughout the process I was kept well informed, treated respectfully and given clear an consistent advice and information. 
I am now recovering from surgery and whilst there are still some weeks to go to complete my treatment I wanted to say how impressed and reassured I have been. I have no doubt that the team work very hard to give patients the best possible outcomes and I’m truly thankful for their care.

readBy.name: Royal United Hospital Bath NHS Trust

title: very good vaccine process
body: well organised vaccine procedure, very speedy, lovely staff and volunteers, most impressed and will join this surgery if possible

title: Great initiative
body: Wonderful work by the practice to increase accessibility to women’s health screening through opening up Saturday clinics. Thinking about how this service can flex to suit the user is an incredible initiative. Very kind and reassuring healthcare professional dealt with me today. Having worked through such difficult times due to the pandemic, it is incredible to see this level of dedication to ongoing patient care. Thank you.

title: Thank you
body: Due to the rules I cannot say thank you to you all by  name - but I should like to say that all my dealings with the practice during the last year have been positive.  I have been able to speak to the correct person on every occasion, whether a nurse practitioner, administrator, or GP and received treatment for a minor complaint which is amazing considering the difficult circumstances that everybody is working under. So thank you all for your kindness, patience and knowledge.

title: Great practice for vaccinations
body:
The place was very organised 
Very helpful staff
Very quick and efficient 
I was in and out in 15 minutes 
Staff were friendly and helpful 
Thank you

title: COVID vaccination
body: Just had my second vaccination at Lane End Surgery. Extremely impressed by their efficiency, organisation, and friendliness. The NHS at its best! Thank you to all the staff and volunteers.

title: Brilliant and very well organised
body: Went in for my first Covid-19 jab on 23/3/21. From the friendly parking attendant directing people where to park your car in the parking area opposite the surgery, the individuals noting arrivals and instructing them on where to go to wait their turn and to the doctor and nurse when I was given the injection- they all did a super job!👏 Thank you 🙏

title: Brilliant
body:
Attended for my 2nd Covid vaccination, very efficient service. Straight in and out, no waiting. All staff courteous.
Thank you.

title: Great Practice
body: Have only been seen by advanced nurses. No complaints. Found them kind and caring.Even in this pandemic you don't have to wait long when you phone. And also get an app. In 48 hours.

title: Absolutely disgraceful
body: You phone you're held for an hour max, at number 15 in the queue to get a response from the phone call. Get to number 1, phone rings only to be told you're number 7 in the queue again. Appointments, forget it. I know these are unprecedented times but the surgery has jumped from 10 to zero. Yes coronavirus is here, yes being careful is paramount for staff & patients but their overall handling of seeing patients is diabolical. Soon as I can I am looking for a different gp practice. We're constantly hearing if you have other issues, that are not covid related, then see your Gp. Problem is it is near on impossible. How are people phoning from 8.30 am and still left waiting for up to an hour to get an answer??? And when you do triage take 5 hours + to call back??

title: Great practice
body:
Friendly and efficient service today for the COVID-19 vaccination .
Friendly and attentive staff.Caring service

title: Uncontactable
body: Is virtually impossible to contact surgery by phone (never answered and rings out) or online currently ( unless you get up at 5am),is this the new normal or overloaded with 17,000 patients now.

title: Covid 2nd Jab
body: This surgery was very efficient all members of staff were very helpful and polite. I am very grateful to all of the staff especially the volunteers for all the hard work. We have been very fortunate to have this surgery so close to our home which has made the journey so much more convenient

title: Non existent service
body: Filled in the e form on the 7/4/21 and received a text saying i would be contacted by 6.30 pm 8/4/21.  Heard nothing so clicked on the email to explain i hadn't heard from them. Was told i would hear by 6.30pm 9/4/21.  Still heard nothing.  Im working full time in constant pain, are you?

title: Super practice
body: Always perfect and so professionally  run  reception is so good always kind and consederate  to us all best doctors surgery  in Essex

title: Friendly and efficient service
body:
I had my 2nd vaccination (Astra Zeneca) this morning.  All staff and volunteers were friendly and helpful making it a pleasant experience, as it had been for my first dose in late January.
It was all well-coordinated and very efficient.  Thank you.

title: Very efficient COVID vaccination centre
body: I attended Lane End Surgery today to receive my second COVID vaccine. This is not my usual surgery. All of the staff and volunteers were incredibly friendly and the whole process was exceptionally well organised and efficient. I great job by everyone! Thank you

title: Brilliant response time
body: I was experiencing chest pain and checked with 111. A report was sent to the Practice and advised I should call the Practice.  A GP telephoned me within 10 minutes of my call and invited me for an examination at the surgery immediately.  I was most impressed with the speed of the service and sympathetic examination by the GP plus his advice. Thank you very much.

title: Very professional
body: Today I had my second Covid Jab and I was extremely impressed by the way the whole system works. I was waiting in line with others and was asked a few questions and then taken inside and within 60 seconds I had been innoculated. Very organised and professional

title: Covid vaccination
body: Very well organised queue moved very quickly volunteers very  pleasant and well organised no fuss made about me having lost my original card

title: nightmare
body: Yesterday got nightmare trying to get connected from 11am !!! Spent 45 minutes ! Terrible service ! Reception not at at all helpful, a management doesn't work absolutely. All negative reviews are same

readBy.name: Meadowgreen Health Centre & The Avenue Medical Practice

title: Great staff under too much pressure
body: I recently attended after my local eye unit told me that although it was urgent they were too busy. I was at this unit for nearly 9 hours before I was seen which caused me some stress and physical discomfort. There were no updates during this time but the staff were clearly under pressure with the sheer numbers. They worked non stop and were polite throughout although some patients became irate . The staff did an excellent job but were just overwhelmed. People were having a go at the staff because there wasn't anybody else. The staff deserved better and I hope management will take whatever action is needed to support their staff before some of them break. As for treatment, I think I finally got a good service but the lack of updates and the sheer waiting time needs to be improved which should not be down to the nursing staff

readBy.name: Sandwell and West Birmingham Hospitals NHS Trust

title: COVID vaccination
body: From the volunteer marshals to the surgery staff, all was brilliantly organized and cheerfully administered.  Congratulations all round!

title: Amazing care
body: I went for an endoscopy and the care I received was excellent. I had everything explained in depth and all the staff were patient, caring and calming throughout the whole procedure. The doctor explained the results at the end and they made sure I was well enough to leave after going through the information again. I am very grateful to the staff who took care of me, they were amazing!

readBy.name: St Helens and Knowsley Hospitals NHS Trust

title: Terrific Team
body:
Covid Team Absolutely Friendly & Reassuring.
The nurse was efficient and it made the whole experience relaxing

title: Most Efficient Practice
body: Attended my second COVID vaccine on 9th April.  Staff were friendly, professional and super efficient. I would like to say a big thank you to everyone in the surgery Also the marshalls outside directing parking. Everything well organised.

title: all staff really great
body: attended for 2 covid-19 vaccinations - each time so smooth and well-organised - marshalling volunteers and staff so helpful, professional and friendly - a very positive experience, thank you

title: Great surgery
body: Just had second COVID jab. Everybody at the surgery were very cheerful and extremely helpful. Thoroughly recommend this surgery after hearing reports from others. Well done everyone.

title: Poor experience with Car Parking
body:
Arrived early for my appointment went to pay parking fee in parking meter to find it was out of order walked the length of car park to other parking meter. Instructions for use not at all clear. Managed to work out how to use the machine (with the help of a younger person) and tried unsuccessfully to insert coins into the machine. It would only accept card payments. After eventually reaching my partner to bring a card to use we eventually managed to pay fee guestimated.
This performance put me under great pressure to reach the outpatients department on time for my appointment. Being hot and bothered is not really an advisable state to be in when attending an Hospital appointment. Can I please ask that Buckland Hospital to considers the system used at Ashford and Canterbury Hospitals.  Importantly you only pay for the time of use of the car park instead of having to guess how long you will need to be parked there. Also the payment machine is so much simpler to use with clear instructions. While waiting for me to return from my appointment (approximately 45 mins) my Partner observed and spoke to three other people experiencing the same difficulties.

readBy.name: East Kent Hospitals University NHS Foundation Trust

title: Covid vaccination
body: All very well organised, all wearing masks, hand sanitiser supplied, friendly staff and vaccination completed very quickly

title: Gone down hill in the last few years.
body: Takes weeks to get an appointment, receptionists are very unhelpful even if you manage to finally get through on the phone, then they decide if you can have an appointment, like they have some kind of magic medical degree, it’s a dreadful service.

title: Great Covid Vaccination point
body: Very well organised, doctors are very friendly and put you at ease, didn’t have to que, was seen very quickly.

title: Patient Aftercare
body: An elderly patient who was indeed registered at your practice, who required his NHS number in order to have his 1st Corona virus vaccine. 1st attempt spoke to a gentleman who had no idea whatsoever, made little effort to clarify this if any. On the second attempt a very pleasant young lady, took seconds to pass on this OAP NHS number, without this we would not have been able to start the process of registering him with a closer more convenient practice. Perhaps the management should look carefully and pay more attention to when they remove patients from their records...maybe, just maybe some people are afraid of visiting their GP and are not capable ( may not know how to ) register with a another Practice. Well done to the young lady who kindly provided the gentleman's NHS number, she is an asset!

title: Friendly staff
body:
Attended today for second Covid vaccination. 
I was really impressed with how friendly the people I came in contact with were. 
All credit to them all in what must be a most difficult time for them all. 
Thank you one and all.

title: Appalling service
body:
After visiting the practise today I was asked to take a seat in the central waiting area where I would be called. A sign at reception informed me that there was a 1hr 45min waiting time which was perfectly acceptable. Patients were being called in, and after 2 hrs 40 mins reception called me and I went straight through. The doctor apologised for the wait end said my name was on a bored for a long time. Given where I was told to sit by the staff, there were no boards visible, other patients were being called by name and reception did not indicate upon arrival that this was the process. The doctor advised that I had been called which was most certainly not the case when I was sat on the main thoroughfare just outside her door. The doctor also advised that she called my mobile phone and upon checking I had no missed phone call even when my correct number was checked upon arrival. 

Upon leaving reception, I politely asked the 3 staff members on reception if they could inform patients that they had to walk to check a bored for their name to come up rather than assume they would be called. One staff member directly in front of me barely looked up from her personal mobile phone and the other two members of staff could not understand the problem of needlessly waiting indoors for nearly 3 hours. Being 20 weeks pregnant and therefore unvaccinated I was keen to get through an efficient system. 

Whilst a poor patient management system is one thing, the ambivalence shown by Corby care centre practise staff is what was most disappointing.

title: Great local doctors on my doorstep
body: I had my Covid jab yesterday here, everything was so organised, I was in and out within minutes. Staff were very approachable, the man on the door sorting out the queue was very helpful.

title: Fantastic service- The Dental Space
body:
My son attended the Dental Space for an operation on the 30th March I cannot put into words how grateful we are for such an amazing team who looked after my son on the day, the team came and introduced themselves and talked us through everything that was going to happen. They made him feel comfortable when being put to sleep making him laugh "especially wanting to share his birthday cake", they also looked after myself when my son was in the operating theatre, coming in to give me updates and the aftercare he needed. They don't get the recognition they deserve and how hard they work especially through a pandemic I couldn't have asked for a more friendly, caring team.
Again just a massive thank your from us to you

readBy.name: University Hospitals of Leicester NHS Trust

title: Brilliant Covid Vaccination service
body: We had our second jabs yesterday. The whole process was faultlessly efficient and all staff were most pleasant, helpful and good-humoured.

title: Totally faultless
body: From arrival at the car park to those guiding us through the system to the nurses administering the jab it was a total pleasure, many thanks.

title: COVID VACCINATION
body:
My wife and I had our 2nd AstraZeneca vaccination today at 13:30. The Surgery was extremely well organised and well manned with Doctors , Nurses and Volunteers. It took us under ten minutes from arrival to getting our paperwork , having a quick chat with the Doctor, getting the “jab” and back into our car. The whole experience was extremely reassuring.           

 God Bless our NHS, All The Doctors & “Care Staff”.

title: excellent service
body: went here for my vaccine and was amazed by the efficiency and speed I was dealt with and the friendly service provided

title: Great Hispital
body: This is my 3rd experience with Circle Bath twice staying and today as a day patient. I would highly recommend this hospital everyone fro reception to consultant are brilliant . Thank you to everyone

title: Coronavirus Vaccination
body:
Attended for 1st AZ vaccine 28 Jan 2021 and 2nd AZ Vaccine 10 April 2021.

Both handled very efficiently and to time.

title: Fantastic care
body:
I attended yesterday for a cataract operation at RBH. From start to finish the medical and nursing care I received was fantastic. All of the nurses I met were friendly & reassuring; I was given a good explanation of what to expect; the surgeon was of course extremely capable & professional, but also empathetic & kind. The nurse escorting me to theatre stroked my arm as I waited to be wheeled in; you’ve no idea how comforting that physical contact is!
The op went smoothly, I was told the result immediately afterwards.
After time to rest, I was discharged with full info & advice on aftercare at home. 
I felt safe and reassured that all the social distancing precautions are in place. This was my 2nd eye op at RBH; each time I’ve had excellent treatment and care. Thank you so much to all of the clinical and support staff.

title: Helpful Practice
body: I had my 2nd Covid vax today and both at this one and the 1st vax the staff (volunteers and nurses) were very helpful and efficient.

title: Very efficient
body: I have just undergone my second covid vaccination at this venue.  On both occasions  there was ample staff and I was dealt with promptly and efficiently.  The experience on this first occasion was first class but matters were even more streamlined on today's visit.

title: Coronavirus vaccine
body: What a great service from staff to volunteers all extremely curteous and knowledgeable it was a pleasure to have your vaccine if that’s possible!!

title: great experience
body:
Beauchamp House patients using Whitley House for Covid-19 vaccinations. My wife and myself consider our experiences at both vaccinations in January 2021 and April 2021 were performed with great care and diligence by all staff and volunteers at Whitley House.
Very reassuring experience. We could see not only ourselves but  all attendees were treated with great care and consideration.

title: Friendly and efficient
body: Visited for second Covid vaccs myself and husband. Staff extremely friendly and we were back out in 10 mins . Good job well done !Thankyou

readBy.name: South Tyneside and Sunderland NHS Foundation Trust

title: Great practice
body: It was very well organised right from the start at the car park. Was directed into a space then from there felt very safe.

title: Very friendly and professional
body: Went to get my COVID vaccine today. The process was very straight forward and staff were all very friendly and professional.

title: Great efficient staff and friendly
body: Attended with mother for COVID vaccines. On both occasions it was well run and staff extremely pleasant and helpful. Well done for a streamlined process.

title: No staff on duty to help patients
body:
I received a letter from Peckwater Medical Centre saying I had to book an appointment within 2wks or I would be discharged from their care.
I am deaf, I dread having to  use phone   as I find it really  very difficult. 
When I phoned Peckwater reception I explained why I called and I hoped I would be able to make an appointment and just leave my contact details. But the receptionist did not want to help. Instead she said I will now put you through to the Consultants Secretary and you must repeat exactly what you have said to me.
She then relayed the call and I was put on ansaphone where I  was told to contact Peckwater Reception, whom I had just spoken with. So now  I have to contact them all over again. I don't know how many more times before I actually get to make an appointment.  

It is really terrible being a patient who needs help and having to go to people who obviously dont care enough to even bother doing what they are there to  do ie answer the phone and make appointments. 
Patricia Brown

title: Good Patient Care
body: Investigation of problem totally resolved by nurse and perfect after a several of visits despite logistical problems of COVID.

title: Very good
body: I had a very good experience at the eye clinic and some great reassurance from the consultant and nurses

title: Great practice
body:
Vaccination appointment has been extremely well organised.
The medical staff and volunteers were very attentive and polite.

title: 9 weeks after sending an email, still no reply...
body:
Sent an email on the 8th Feb regarding a referral through Right To Choose, including a pre-filled diagnostic checklist to make it quicker for the GP, and was told the GP would respond in around 10 days...it's now been almost 9 weeks and still I have not received a response from the GP. Having followed up the email in March asking when I could expect this to be I didn't receive a reply from anybody to this either. 

In addition, the first 3 times I rang to chase it up I was told by reception staff it had been sent to the GP and was just waiting for her, the 4th time I rang a different lady answered and informed me this was a lie and it had not yet even been sent to the GP. Getting extremely frustrated and now trying to save to get a private diagnosis as it doesn't seem likely I'll even receive a response at this point.

title: Undoubtedly one of the best clinics in the UK.
body: Continued excellent medical attention with all the attributes mentioned in my last review. In my (considerable) experience of practitioners not only in the UK but throughout Europe, the Middle East and South America it couldn't be better. The NHS has lost countless practitioners who lost their lives serving the public like you and me and to date over 117000 others. And complainers complain about a thirty minute wait on the phone!Grow up and smell the coffee.

title: Sorry State of Affairs
body: I booked the phone consultation three separate occasions and was never called by anyone. I reported online that I was not  contacted and was told someone would get in touch.. it did not happen. Not sure if anyone in the surgery cares enough to reach out to patients queries. Disappointing outcome

title: Fantastic
body: Attended this Surgery for my second CONVID jab. As was my first visit it was so well organised, everybody helpful, an absolutely superb service. Thank you everyone.

title: Poor service
body: Trying to get an appointment is very frustrating. I have booked on several occasions and they don’t get back. Ive been waiting for someone to contact me for 3 weeks now.
